titles.title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to enter into contracts with the Solano County Water Agency, California, to use Solano Project facilities for impounding, storage, and carriage of nonproject water for domestic, municipal, industrial, and other beneficial purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.
Subcommittee on Water and Power Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-426.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 248.

action.text: Mr. Doolittle moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1235.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Committee consideration held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-433.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 855.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 3/23/1999--Introduced. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to enter into water contracts with the Solano County Water Agency or any of its member unit contractors for the impounding, storage, and carriage of nonproject water for domestic, municipal, industrial, and other purposes, and for the exchange of water among such contractors for such purposes, using facilities associated with the Solano Project, California.
